attributes.action: To be given a choice to be fitted with an ICD when diagnosed with Brugada.
attributes.background: My partner was diagnosed with Brugada in July 2015, had numerous tests but was classed as low risk. He begged to be fitted with an ICD and each time was told he didn't need one as he had no history of heart attacks in his family. He died august 2016. Losing my partner has destroyed me and our son.
attributes.additional_details: Lewis was told when diagnosed that he was able to live a long and healthy life. He died one year later. He repeatedly asked if their was any medication he could take and was told there was no need. I believe being fitted with an Implantable cardioverter defibrillator would have saved my partners life. My son is without his daddy. I want people with the same condition to have the choice, low risk or high to have an ICD fitted. I am asking for two minutes of peoples time. I am begging.

attributes.action: Keep open the 'Dubs scheme' to resettle 3000 unaccompanied refugee children.
attributes.background: The Home Office has announced that the 'Dubs scheme' to resettle unaccompanied refugee children in the UK will close after just 350 children are helped. At the time of its creation, campaigners called for it to aid 3000 children. The UK is turning its back on the most vulnerable people in the world.
attributes.additional_details: The 'Dubs scheme' is named after Lord Dubs, who got an amendment to the Immigration Act passed last year. His amendment did not specify a number of children, but campaigners made clear that thousands of vulnerable refugee children were stranded and alone, and called on the UK government to help up to 3000 of them. Announcing that the scheme will only help 350 children - about one for every local authority - is a callous, inhumane act which leaves children at huge risk of deprivation and abuse.

attributes.action: The Legalization of all forms of cannabis for recreational and medicinal use.
attributes.background: Legalization would prove far more beneficial to society, if regulated and taxed. The revenue generated from taxation can be funneled into the NHS and education. The criminal justice system which is already under pressure from cuts will save money. Thousands of jobs created increasing tax revenue.
attributes.additional_details: Tourism will be boosted, which in turn will boost local economies creating even more employment. The benefits to the NHS in terms of prescribing medicinal cannabis instead of expensive drugs will give a significant reduction in the drugs bill of Â£15 billion. There is a lot of misinformation which fuels concerns but having cannabis illegal causes a lot of problems we see today. It's time we take a logical approach rather than an ideological approach.

attributes.action: CONDEMN Art 25(b) of Indian Constitution Which Violates Sikhs' Religious Freedom
attributes.background:
Sikhs were recognized by the Britain as privy to Indian Independence Act, 1947, on the basis of their separate religious identity.
Today, UK is home to over 800,000 Sikhs who have excelled in every walk of life.
On Jan 26 1950, India promulgated constitution abolishing separate status of Sikhism.
attributes.additional_details:
Art 25(b) of Indian Constitution labels Sikhs as Hindus and forces the Sikh community to follow HINDU Marriage Act; Succession Act; Minority and Guardianship Act;  Adoption and Maintenance Act.

With over 30 million followers, Sikhism is recognized as separate religion throughout the world, except in India.

We urge the UK Government to:

"CONDEMN Article 25(b) of the Indian Constitution which violates religious freedom and identity of Sikhs by labeling them as Hindus".

attributes.action: Stop Northern Rail from introducing Driver-Only operation.
attributes.background: The new Northern Rail franchise was awarded to Arriva (ultimately owned by German state railway Deutsche Bahn) from 1 April 2016. The new franchise includes a commitment to switch some routes to Driver Only Operation. This would allow trains to be operated with only one member of staff - the driver.
attributes.additional_details: Currently trains operating on the Northern franchise require a minimum of two safety-trained members of staff: the driver and the conductor. Driver Only Operation will mean the downgrading of the conductor to a ticket vendor, and in some cases there might not even be a ticket vendor on board. A second safety-trained crew member will always be safer than having only the one. This will allow Arriva / Deutsche Bahn to maximise profit by paying their staff less.

attributes.action: Make it a specific criminal offence to assault an HM Prison Officer.
attributes.background:
A report has revealed that, over a two month period last year, prisoners assaulted more than 1,000 prison officers. This includes 95 of the highest category 'serious' assaults on staff, such as being slashed with homemade weapons.

The two monthly total equates to more than 16 attacks a day.

attributes.action: Cold calling by phone or email for investment or pensions should be made illegal
attributes.background: Cold calling on investments and pensions to members of the public  very often leads to unregulated investments and scams. Banning cold calling would dramatically reduce the number of people falling prey to fraudsters and losing their savings and pensions.

attributes.action: MPs' salary rises to be restricted to the same as public sector workers by law
attributes.background: Public Sector workers have been restricted to a 1% annual pay rise for the last five years, a lot of them have had a pay freeze during this time, whilst MPs are exempt  from the restrictions they place on Public Sector workers. MPs should be subject to the same annual pay rises by law.

attributes.action: Give more funding to brain tumour research.
attributes.background: Government spend on brain tumour research represented just 0.52% of its total spend on cancer research.  This cancer is the biggest killer of the under 40 age group. More funding is needed to help research this most aggressive form of cancer that is killing so many people.

attributes.action: Everyone in the UK must have a vote on who is elected Mayor of London.
attributes.background: Sadiq Kahn has been getting involved in foreign political matters and policies that affect not just London but the rest of the UK. If any Mayor of London can meddle (Unchecked) in political activities that affect the whole of the UK, then the whole of the UK should have a say in who is Mayor!
attributes.additional_details:
His pro-Hillary Clinton tour of the United States, whose appointment will have an affect on everyone in the UK.
His joint venture with Obama to tackle anti hate speech against Muslims online.. no mention of hate crimes committed by Muslims. He recently quoted âtoo many white menâ working for the cityâs underground train service.

attributes.action: Stop business rate rises before they wreck independent high street retailers
attributes.background: Independent retailers in many towns face rate increases which will force them out of business. National chains are pushing up property values, and independents are paying for this in their rates. Higher property values do not mean more turnover. The unintended consequence will be bland high streets.
attributes.additional_details: The new business rates have an unsound basis. Rising property values are a cost to small retailers, not a source of profit. Increasing rates in line with property values is a double burden which will be the end for many much-loved retailers, and will turn interesting high streets into identical dull parades of chain coffee shops, charity outlets, and predictable national retailers. Local councils should not be wrecking their own high streets. Business rates need to be reconsidered.

attributes.action: Make 'Nutritionist' a legally protected title
attributes.background: Currently, due to lack of regulation, anyone can set up and practice as a nutritionist/nutritional therapist, meaning there is no real protection for consumers. The Government should take action to prevent unqualified people from potentially putting peopleâs health at risk.
attributes.additional_details: There is very little understanding about what a âRegistered Nutritionistâ is and how it compares to a nutritional therapist, nutritionist, nutrition advisor (the list of terms goes on). Yes, we have a UK voluntary register of Nutritionists held by the Association for Nutrition but this goes (mostly) unnoticed by the media and the public. Itâs vital that we increase the awareness of this register so that people understand where to go to for accurate, evidence based advice.

attributes.action: Ensure a new hospital is built central to all West Hertfordshire communities
attributes.background:
It must be purpose-built and equipped to modern standards with enough space for parking and future expansion.

We are members of the New Hospital Campaign formed to request a new hospital on a central, accessible site between the three main towns - Hemel Hempstead, St. Albans and Watford.
attributes.additional_details:
The local NHS is proposing to keep the Watford site in Vicarage Road as the acute hospital. This plan is not sustainable: it cannot meet the health needs of the people of the area. The estate requires Â£100m of backlog maintenance and cannot be brought up to modern standards. 

We need a new hospital that everyone can get to, which surveys have repeatedly shown patients want. The present hospital is in a congested corner of our area, next to the ground of a Premier League football club.

attributes.action: Exempt Non-EU NHS professionals from Â£35,000 salary threshold
attributes.background: Since April 2016, Non-EU citizens wishing to remain permanently in the UK have been required to earn Â£35,000 a year on a single contracted salary. I find this rule discriminates unfairly against those who chose to work in the NHS, where such a salary is impossible within first 5 years of employment.
attributes.additional_details:
Like many others I came to the UK to complete my MSc and now wish to remain working for NHS making differences to people's lives on a daily basis. I have been living here for over 7 years and working extra hours during nights/weekends to meet the threshold however it is not good enough to secure my place here unless something changes.
Sadly there are many others facing the same hardship and I believe that the threshold should be lowered to at least the average UK salary Â£28,000 for NHS staff.

attributes.action: Reassess general aviation airfields as green belt not brown field sites.
attributes.background: Airfields around the country are categorised  as brown field sites making them attractive for development of housing estates. However these airfields are 90% grass land. Reassessing them as green belt will protect our green countryside, protect local employment and protect general aviation.
attributes.additional_details: General Aviation airfields are home to wild flowers, plants and grasses as well as many small animals and birds. Our future commercial pilots start their training at these airfields which provide local employment. We will miss this national resource when it's too late and they have been dug up for housing. These are green sites and must be afforded the same protection as farm land.

attributes.action: As soon as the UK exits the EU legislate to end the export of live farm animals.
attributes.background:
The transport of live animals exported from the UK causes immense suffering. This trade is governed by EU law, not the UK government.

The government should plan legislation to ban the export of live farm animals in favour of a carcass only trade and introduce this as soon as we leave the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
Long distance travel causes enormous suffering: overcrowding; pain and stress; compromised immunity; inhumane slaughter on arrival; loss of legal safeguards. SOURCE CIWF

During live transport there is a high risk of animal suffering: handling during loading and unloading; strange sights and sounds and animals; heat stress and lack of water and rest. SOURCE RSPCA

Animals are crammed into unsuitable transport and endure gruelling journies heading for conditions illigal in this country. RSPCA

attributes.action: Remove the Ban on agency fees and set a cap for fees instead.
attributes.background: It is unfair for small businesses to survive especially after the increase in online estate agency and banning the agency fee makes it more difficult for estate agency to survive. To meet costs banned fee would be forwarded to landlords who would pass the cost onto tenants by increasing their rents.
attributes.additional_details:
It seems unfair for agents to charge tenants fee however Estate agents has to pay fees for referencing, Staff for viewings, Company cars, membership of professional bodies to regulated Fair trade, subscription for property portals and etc.These are paid for providing a professional first class service to the landlord and tenants.
To cover these costs agents should be allowed to charge agency fees. A cap should be set for agency fees instead so it would be fair for the tenants and Agents.

attributes.action: To Make it an Offence in Law to Desecrate a Memorial or Grave to War Dead
attributes.background:
There has been many cases of people urinating and damaging war memorials and they have been charged with Out Raging Public Decency.
The full weight of the law must be brought down on people that do this with a prison sentence,Memorials to those that gave there live`s for us must be protected
attributes.additional_details: Kelly Martin was on bail for urinating on a war memorial in Grays,Essex,UK April 2016, On the 30 June 2016 the day before the world commemorated the 100th anniversary of the Battle of the Somme she did the same thing at the same memorial again in front of shoppers and children,The case was reported world wide and upset not only veterans,serving members of forces all over the world including family members of those named on the memorial. Sentencing guidelines must be put in place. She got 7 months

attributes.action: Allow all children of all ages to receive the meningitis B vaccine on the NHS
attributes.background: Meningitis B is rhe most common cause of bacterial Meningitis by which children's lives are taken. As vaccines are the only way to prevent meningitis this vaccine should be offered to all children, not just those born after June 2015. It can be paid for privately which many people cannot afford.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.meningitis.org/menb-vaccine

attributes.action: Stop The Closure Of Darlington A&E
attributes.background: The government is trying to close down Darlington A&E which we cant let happen.Doing this will cause people to travel excessive distances and if they don't have a car this may not be possible.It will also put strain on the out of town hospitals and will endanger lives that are emergencies.

attributes.action: Teresa may to recognise endometriosis under the equality act 2010
attributes.background: This is a debilitating illness that affects 1 in 10 women in the UK. It's a chronic condition that causes painful and heavy periods. It has a significant impact on a woman's life in a number of ways including chronic pain, fatigue and depression. The cause is unknown and there is no definitive cure.
attributes.additional_details: Women who suffer often face criticism from their employer and sometimes can lead to them leaving employment. Women endure so much when they are suffering and may even be faced with infertility. The last thing they need is to worry about their work life. Endometriosis needs to be formally recognised under the equality act  2010. In other countries it is recognised as a disability.

attributes.action: Give votes urgently to the 5Â½ million excluded from the Brexit referendum
attributes.background: The political scene is fragile and unstable because of the Governmentâs small majority with most MPs opposed to Brexit.  Urgently enfranchise the some 5Â½ million excluded from the Brexit referendum (46Â½ million electors) so that future elections and referendums are more properly representative
attributes.additional_details:
The 5Â½ million are
a) 1.5 million 16- and 17-year olds in the UK (as could vote in the Scottish referendum)
b) 2.0 million British Citizens living abroad disqualified by the 15-year rule or because never on a UK electoral roll (as in the Conservativesâ as-yet unkept âVotes for Lifeâ manifesto promise)
c) 2.2 million unenfranchised foreigners living permanently in the UK (as would be electors if in New Zealand)

Numbers are derived from 2014-15 ONS and UN data. For details visit bit.ly/2cn7hrO

attributes.action: Make co-operation with Trump administration conditional on human rights.
attributes.background:
Angela Merkel promised co-operation on the condition that âvalues of democracy, freedom and respect for the law and the dignity of man, independent of origin, skin colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation or political viewsâ were upheld.
The UK Government should publicly adopt the same stance.

attributes.action: Do not discriminate against drivers of diesel cars
attributes.background: There is a move to charge diesel cars extra for parking and travelling in city centres even though the government encouraged the purchase of diesel cars due to their efficiency and low CO2 emissions.
attributes.additional_details:
We the undersigned believe this is wrong and people with diesel cars should not be discriminated against, charged more for parking or forced to pay additional costs to use their vehicles.

We call upon Theresa May and her government to protect people who purchased diesel cars, which are amongst the most efficient vehicles available, and stop any current or proposed charges which discriminate against diesel engine cars being levied by councils and local authorities.

attributes.action:
Block or change the EASA Commission Regulation
on Unmanned Aircraft Operations
attributes.background:
The UK UAV industry is currently thriving
and is even recognised by EASA themselves âUnmanned aircraft is a sector of aviation that is developing very fast and has a great potential for producing new jobs and growth.â

 BUT With the EASA new proposed regulations all of this is under threat.
attributes.additional_details:
âDronesâ and other UAV are well covered under the Civil Aviation Authority Air Navigation Order. Regarded by most as fair and accurate

EASA proposals will override this (even once we have left the EU)
And have clearly been written by people with little understand of the subject. the expected result of them is:

* Death of the related industry (not a slowdown but an outright death)

* Public disregard for all rules

*cease of UAV use for UK emergency services and other lifesaving uses

attributes.action: Make dog theft a criminal offence with custodial sentence and hefty fines.
attributes.background: All too often, we read in local papers and facebook groups that dogs are being stolen, whether it be for fights or breeding. These animals are not just pets from some people but dearly loved members of the family. When thieves take an animal they leave a huge whole in the hearts of those left behind
attributes.additional_details: Every day we read about another dog stolen, the heartbreak that families & individuals are going through. The hours spent distrubuting leafts, posters for just some hint of where their pet maybe.  In one area alone, I have hears of 3 cockers missing within a matter of days of each other. Coincidence? At a dog walking area: reports of people walking with a lead and no dog,  on one occasion, a young lad  confronted the "walker" because it was his dog that had was now on the empty lead.

attributes.action: To define marriage as exclusively only between one man and one woman.
attributes.background: The definition of marriage by the UK parliament should be the traditional definition of One Man and One Woman, nothing else, and should be taught as such in the education system.
attributes.additional_details: 1611 KJV Bible

attributes.action: Ban and make illegal Puppy Farms in the UK
attributes.background: Puppy farms are a money making machine only, the pups and parents are often if not always not cared for properly and end up with behavioural issues and other medical issues.
attributes.additional_details:
Using bitches as breeding machines is disgusting and no reputable breeder would ever do this. There are already many unwanted dogs in the UK, putting a strain on the RSPCA and the many charitable private dog Rescues. There is simply no need for puppy farms at all, they are cruel and should be stopped.

http://www.thekennelclub.org.uk/our-resources/kennel-club-campaigns/puppy-farming/

attributes.action: Develop a GCSE in Natural History.
attributes.background: Re-engagement with Britain's natural history has never been more urgent. Young people need the skills to name, observe, monitor and record wildlife. It is vital to understand the contribution nature makes to our lives  physically, culturally, emotionally and scientifically both in the past and today
attributes.additional_details:
Britainâs reputation for recording its natural history was unsurpassed anywhere in the world. Those skills are disappearing as new generations are increasingly disconnected. The UK also has outstanding nature writing, art, poetry, film and radio. It has always been integral to our culture and heritage. 
Tony Juniper: âThis is a brilliant idea and I am happy to endorse, support and advocate however I can.â
Professor Tim Birkhead FRS: âThis is the best idea I have heard about for a long time.â

attributes.action: Call on Government to commission an independent technical review of HS2
attributes.background:
HS2 cannot meet its stated objective of delivering â..hugely enhanced capacity and connectivity between our major conurbationsâ. 

We call on HM Government to commission an independent technical review of every aspect of the HS2 scheme to determine how and why this failure has happened.
attributes.additional_details: HS2 is an ill-conceived and fundamentally flawed design for a high speed rail line linking London, Birmingham, Leeds and Manchester. Originally costed at Â£30 billion, it is now estimated to cost Â£56 billion or more. The project is highly controversial because of HS2 Ltdâs failure to evaluate cheaper & better alternatives, its exorbitant cost, insufficient new capacity, poor connectivity, demolition of 500+ homes, serious damage to the Chilterns AONB & Ancient Woodlands and failure to reduce CO2

attributes.action: NHS pensions for ALL Dental Care Professionals who work in NHS Dental Practices.
attributes.background: Dental Care Professionals working in General Dental Practices with an NHS contract, providing NHS care are not entitled to an NHS pension and the full benefits of providing NHS care to patients. Working under or alongside NHS Dental practice owners or associate dentists who are entitled to this.
attributes.additional_details: All members of the Dental Team whether that be a Dental Nurse working along side an NHS dentist, Dental Therapists and Hygienists who work under a Dentist or associates prescription, or the Practice Managers and reception/admin staff ALL contribute to an NHS contract and the NHS care provided to patients.

attributes.action: Order a public enquiry into the PCSE Contract, and its impact on NHS services.
attributes.background: The Primary Care Support England contract was awarded to Capita by NHS England and commenced in March 2016. The service has lost countless medical records, placed services in jeopardy, and resulted in delays to junior doctors being able to start in their posts.

attributes.action: Protect the A&E and Women & Children's Unit at Telford's Princess Royal Hospital
attributes.background:
Future Fit ('FF') was tasked with improving care in the Telford and Shrewsbury Hospitals.

FF's proposals include closing one of the two current A&E units and possibly moving Women and Children's ('WC') services, despite investment in a dedicated Â£28 million facility in Telford just two years ago.
attributes.additional_details:
Both Telford and Shropshire have growing populations and accommodate different geographical locations; both current A&E units struggle - local healthcare needs expanding not retracting. Reducing to one A&E will cause unnecessary strain, and ultimately, deaths.

In 2014 the Health Secretary promised that âwe commit to A&E on both sites and there are no plans to change thatâ. Mr Hunt is called upon to ensure that commitment is kept.

Moving WC services would be a waste of a Â£28 million investment.

attributes.action: Hold a public inquiry into the Prison System
attributes.background:
Our Prison System is in crisis - experts accurately describe it as in 'meltdown'. 
A plethora of independent HMI Prison inspection reports has consistently supported this view. 
Yesterday prison officers raised anguished voices, outside our prisons in guttural cries of despair. 
Enough is enough.
attributes.additional_details: Our Prison System has no direction, funding, or vision for delivery. Prison staff are daily facing drugs, drones, suicides, self-harm, murders, escapes from closed conditions, and vicious physical assaults from drug-induced prisoners now running at 65 assaults a day, every day. Enough is enough. Independent HMI Prison inspection  reports deliver evidence weekly of decay and collapse. We need an independent inquiry into the future of the Prison  Service, it's mission, conditions and resources.

attributes.action: Change the DLA guide to reflect the needs of children with heart conditions.
attributes.background: 12 children each day in the UK are born with heart defects, others acquire them due to viruses. Outcomes for these children have never been better with surgical advances, but they need supervision, care and medication to allow them to live longer lives.  Many also have mobility needs.
attributes.additional_details: DLA is a benefit for children with disabilities.   Decision Makers have a guide which they use to make awards.  However because heart conditions do not appear in this guide even though they were in the old 'adult' version, Decision Makers have no guidance as to what awards to give.  Because of this, often they will make no award at all.  Sometimes they make awards that don't truly reflect the needs of the child and will only make them for short periods of time when these conditions are for life.

attributes.action: Give CAMHS more funding and make them a more efficient system.
attributes.background:
CAMHS system makes everything much more difficult for parents and children with additional needs. 
 TAF meetings in which the same things are said over and over again,  no support given,  expecting other unqualified in the field services to help families, long waiting lists of over a year.
attributes.additional_details:
Waiting YEARS for assessments on children's mental health/additional needs is UNACCEPTABLE, whilst other families slip completely through the net. 
 It's paramount to neglect, if parents were to neglect their child(ren)  they'd be put on child protection,  yet services which are supposed to help children are allowed to NEGLECT their responsibilities, through excuses of lack of funding. CAMHS are extremely unorganised,  and inefficient to more than half of the families they are supposed to he helping.

attributes.action: Remove parental responsibility for parents absent longer than 3 years
attributes.background: Absent parents should not have a say over children they do not see or contribute to. If they do not have contact for over 3 years the residing parent should be allowed to have PR removed without contacting absent parent

attributes.action: Support the establishment of a European Associate Citizenship for UK Citizens
attributes.background:
Charles Goerens, MEP, has tabled an amendment calling for Associate Citizenship of the EU to be offered to citizens of former EU member states. 

This proposal offers a realistic and worthwhile compromise for the 16,141,241 people who voted to remain, at no cost to the UK taxpayer.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Government has a responsibility to the millions of UK Citizens who voted remain. 

This petition calls on the Government to support the establishment of a European Associate Citizenship. Such a move would soften the blow of Brexit for those passionate about the European project, ensure the millions of UK citizens who live and work in the EU can continue the lives they have chosen, and would give future generations the option to live and work in Europe. 

It would cost the UK nothing.

attributes.action: Remove Abortions From The NHS
attributes.background: An innocent life is being taken whenever an abortion is performed. As someone who pays taxes to a great health service, I want to see this procedure removed from the NHS.
attributes.additional_details:
Science agrees that human development begins at conception: 
âHuman development begins after the union of male and female gametes or germ cells during a process known as fertilization (conception).â[Moore, Keith L. Essentials of Human Embryology. Toronto: B.C. Decker Inc, 1988, p.2]

As the fertilized embryo has all the genetic components of an individual human they should receive the same rights as born humans. The right to life is a fundamental cornerstone to western society as we know it and abortions stand in direct opposition to that right.

attributes.action: Government to immediately legislate that  visitors to UK  have Health Insurance
attributes.background: The NHS is a great institution, and unfortunately is now in dire straits. Health tourists  are taking advantage of a system that is not fit for purpose.  On arrival into the country  medical insurance must be provided with immediate effect.

attributes.action: UK must apologise for the Balfour Declaration & lead peace efforts in Palestine
attributes.background: We call on Her Majestyâs Government to openly apologise to the Palestinian people for issuing the Balfour Declaration. The colonial policy of Britain between 1917-1948 led to mass displacement of the Palestinian nation.
attributes.additional_details: HMG should recognise its role during the Mandate and now must lead attempts to reach a solution that ensures justice for the Palestinian people.

attributes.action: Remove all tolls from the River Mersey.
attributes.background: The River Mersey will end up with 2 bridges and x2 tunnels that will be tolled in the next 12 months. The cost of the build, upkeep and repair of these huge national infrastructures have been given to the people of Merseyside. Who pays for the upkeep of the bridges & tunnels of The River Thames.
attributes.additional_details:
The bridges & tunnels are part of the national infrastructure and should not be the responsibility of the people of Merseyside in the same way the bridge to Skye is not theirs to pay for, the Bridges of The Thames are not purely for the people of London.
there are many roads, bridges & tunnels that are paid for nationally including the upkeep, I feel the same should be done on Merseyside.

attributes.action: Immediate General Election if Article 50 not triggered before April 2017
attributes.background: By April 2017, the British People will have waited 9 months since the Referendum result for Article 50 to be triggered. Not doing so in this time shows disrespect for the British Voters, therefore signatures on this petition have no confidence in the British Government and demand a General Election

attributes.action: Make the NHS pay for Bone Marrow Transplant For Adult Sickle Cell Patients
attributes.background: Bone marrow transplant offers a cure for some sickle cells patients, while children have access to this treatment under the NHS, adults do not, even though medical advances have made it a clinically safe procedure with an 85% success rate, in sickle cell adult patients treated in Europe and USA
attributes.additional_details: If the evidence exists internationally that patients could be cured of this disorder with a bone marrow transplant, there is a sense that UK sickle adult patients experience health inequalities around their treatment options and this contradicts NHS values. A successful bone marrow transplant means patients not enduring painful crises or recurrent hospitalisation. This saves the NHS money in the long run, enabling patients to lead healthy productive lives, and not being held hostage by illness

attributes.action: Suspend all trials of graded exercise therapy in children and adults with ME/CFS
attributes.background: In surveys hundreds of patients have reported harm â some becoming housebound or bedbound, indefinitely â from graded exercise therapy (GET). The Government must demand that research and funding bodies suspend all trials of graded exercise therapy for ME/CFS until the evidence has been reassessed.
attributes.additional_details: Clinical trials such as MAGENTA still use graded exercise therapy, even in children, but are being justified on the basis of the flawed PACE trial. Scientists have severely criticised PACE, the major adult trial that claimed the therapy to be safe and effective. Thousands have demanded retraction of PACEâs âmisleadingâ analyses and 24 ME/CFS charities from 14 countries demanded that its data be released for reanalysis. PACE is no basis for a trial in children or adults. Read more at stopGET.org

attributes.action: Make it illegal for all animal skins and furs to be imported and sold in the UK
attributes.background:
Each year 50 million animals are violently killed for use in the fashion industry. They are beaten, electrocuted and skinned alive for their skins and furs. 

The fur and skin industry is outdated, cruel and unnecessary. It must be consigned to history.
attributes.additional_details:
Cruelty Assured: http://features.peta.org.uk/origin-assured-fur/

9 Shocking Fur facts: http://www.peta.org/features/nine-shocking-fur-facts/

Fur Facts: http://www.bornfreeusa.org/facts.php?p=452&more=1

attributes.action: Cut all public funding to Tony Blair - This to include protection & expenses
attributes.background: Tony Blair is costing the taxpayer millions of pounds a year in police protection, as well as blurring the line between his work and his business interests.  Tony is too vocal trying to split this country asking for EU remainers to rise up against democracy, he needs to be stopped.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2017/02/17/dont-trust-tony-blairs-rise-brexit-speech-leaves-many-social/

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/investigations/revealed-the-true-scale-of-tony-blairs-global-business-empire/

attributes.action: Training Paediatric Medical Professionals in Diagnosing Craniosynostosis
attributes.background: Craniosynostosis is a skull condition that causes a baby to be born with, or develop an abnormally shaped head. The irregular skull shape causes severe symptoms resulting from increased pressure in the skull, it affects 1 in every 3,000 babies born each year but is a largely unheard of condition.
attributes.additional_details: Lucy's Head Start is campaigning for mandatory training for paediatric medical professionals leading to earlier diagnosis.Families involved with Lucy's Head Start have reported that some but not all midwives, health vistors or GPs have dismissed, missed, misdiagnosed or mistaken their child's condition for flat head due to lack of awareness, which is why we desperately need mandatory training.Most children diagnosed require surgery and early intervention is vital to prevent severe symptoms.

attributes.action: Shift Agricultural Subsidies to Support Environmental Protections post-Brexit.
attributes.background:
The government should redirect subsidies in a post-Brexit domestic agricultural policy, away from environmentally damaging farming, and towards environmental protections. 

Subsidies are needed to support farmers who tackle climate change, mitigate floods, increase biodiversity and soil health.

attributes.action: Overturn the decision to sell off Preston's historic Fulwood Barracks.
attributes.background: The decision to announce the end of the home of the Duke of Lancaster's regiment as part of the biggest sell-offs of military land any Government has ever announced has been met with shock, surprise and anger by the people of Lancashire.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.lep.co.uk/your-lancashire/preston/fulwood-barracks-to-close-in-shock-mod-move-1-8224299
The Grade II listed building has been home of the Queen's Lancashire Regiment for nearly 150 years and now houses four Infantry battalions. It also houses the popular Lancashire Infantry Museum, the largest Regimental archive in the north of England.
The Barracks is an important part of the history and culture of Preston and it is a vital link between the local regiment and the population.
